Purpose in Life Test (Crumbaugh & Maholick, 1964)
Instructions: Write the number (1 to 5) next to each statement that is most true for you right now.

Disclaimer: This form is based on the Purpose in Life Test written by Crumbaugh & Maholick in 1964, it is not an exact rendition of the test, and this version is not endorsed by Crumbaugh & Maholick. What's more, this form was created for the public good and was not created for monitization. If this form is against the wishes of any rights holder, please message the pens creator here on codepen or via email through zarymanning@gmail.com. I will promptly remove the pin.



1.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being bored and 5 being entusiastic -

I am usually:

Bored - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Enthusiastic






2.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being completely routine and 5 being always exciting -

My life usually seems:

Completely Routine - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Always Exciting






3.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being no goals and 5 being clear goals -

In my life, I have:

No Goals - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Clear Goals






4.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being utterly meaningless and 5 being meaningful -

My personal existence is:

Utterly meaningless - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Meaningful






5.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being the same and 5 being new and different -

Every day in my life is:

The Same - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - New and Different






6.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 prefering to never have been born and 5 being a wish for 9 lives like this one -

If I could choose, I would:

Prefer to never have been born - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Wish for 9 lives like this one






7.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being loaf completely the rest of my life and 5 being do some of the things I've always wanted to do -

After retiring, I would:

Loaf completely the rest of my life - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Do some of the exciting things I've always wanted to do






8.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being made no progress whatever and 5 being progressed to complete fulfillment -

In achieving life goals, I've:

Made no progress whatever - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Progressed to complete fulfillment






9.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being empty and filled only with dispair and 5 being running over with exciting things -

My life is:

Empty, filled only with despair - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Running over with exciting things






10.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being completely worthless and 5 being very worthwhile -

If I should die today, I'd feel that my life has been:

Completely worthless - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Very worthwhile






11.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being I often wonder why I exist and 5 being I always see reasons for being here -

In thinking of my life, I:

Often wonder why I exist - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Always see reasons for being here






12.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being the world completely confuses me and 5 being the world fits meaningfully with my life -

As I view the world in relation to my life, the world:

Completely confuses me - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Fits meaningfully with my life






13.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being I am very irresponsible person and 5 being I am a very responsible person -

I am a:

Very irresponsible person- 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Very responsible person






14.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being I believe humans are completely bound by limitations of heredity and environment and 5 being I believe humans are totally free to make all life choices -

I believe humans are:

Completely bound by limitations of heredity and environment - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Totally free to make all life choices






15.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being I am unprepared and frightened of death, and 5 being I am prepared and unafraid -

With regard to death, I am:

Unprepared and frightened - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Prepared and unafraid






16.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being I have seriously thought of suicide as a way out, and 5 being I have never given it a second thought -

With regard to suicide, I have:

Thought of it seriously as a way out - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Never given it a second thought






17.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being practically none and 5 being very great -

I regard my ability to find a purpose or mission in life as:

Practically none - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - Very great






18.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being out of my hands and controlled by external factors and 5 being in my hands and I'm in control of it -

My life is:

Out of my hands and controlled by external factors - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - In my hands and I'm in control of it






19.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being a painful and boring experience and 5 being a source of pleasure and satisfaction -

Facing my daily tasks is:

A painful and boring experience - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - A source of pleasure and satisfaction






20.) On a scale of 1 through 5, with 1 being no mission or purpose in life and 5 being a satisfying life purpose -

I have discovered:

No mission or purpose in life - 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, - A satisfying life purpose








What does my score mean? A score of less than 50 may indicate that you are experiencing an "existential void," or a lack of meaning or purpose in your life right now.
